def.__text: the first letter of the Greek alphabet
alpha; the first letter of the Greek alphabet.
Aaron, son of Amram and Jochebed, brother of Moses.

Abaddon, Destroyer (i.e. Destroying Angel) or "place of destruction"
                  (personified).
not burdensome, bringing no weight or oppression upon.
Abel, second son of Adam and Eve, brother of Cain.

Abijah, (a) a king, son of Rehoboam, (b) founder of the eighth class of
                  priests.
Abiathar, a priest in King David's time.

the Abilenian territory, the territory of Abila (in Syria), a small
                  principality in the mountains of Damascus.
Abiud, son of Zerubbabel and father of Eliakim.
Abraham, progenitor of the Hebrew race.

the abyss, unfathomable depth, an especially Jewish conception, the
                  home of the dead and of evil spirits.
I work that which is good, perform good deeds.
I do that which is good
I do that which is good.
the doing of that which is good
the doing of that which is good, well-doing.
a doer of that which is good
a doer of that which is good.

intrinsically good, good in nature, good whether it be seen to be so or
                  not, the widest and most colorless of all words with this meaning.

intrinsic goodness, especially as a personal quality, with stress on
                  the kindly (rather than the righteous) side of goodness.
wild joy, ecstatic delight, exultation, exhilaration.
I exult, am full of joy
I exult, am full of joy.

unmarried, of a person not in a state of wedlock, whether he or she has
                  formerly been married or not.

I love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of
                  reason, esteem.
love, benevolence, good will, esteem; plur: love-feasts.

loved, beloved, with two special applications: the Beloved, a title of
                  the Messiah (Christ), as beloved beyond all others by the God who sent Him; of
                  Christians, as beloved by God, Christ, and one another.
Hagar, the servant of Sarah, concubine of Abraham.
I impress (into my service), send (on an errand).

a messenger, generally a (supernatural) messenger from God, an angel,
                  conveying news or behests from God to men.
of unrecorded genealogy, whose descent cannot be traced.
lit: without family, hence: ignoble, base.

I make holy, treat as holy, set apart as holy, sanctify, hallow,
                  purify.

the process of making or becoming holy, set apart, sanctification,
                  holiness, consecration.
set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred.
holiness, sanctity, as an abstract quality.
an arm, especially as bent to receive a burden.
I cleanse, purify, either ceremonially, actually, or morally.
I do not know, am ignorant of

I do not know, am ignorant of (a person, thing, or fact), sometimes
                  with the idea of willful ignorance.

an offence committed through ignorance, an error due to (willful or
                  culpable) ignorance.

ignorance, inadvertence, sometimes with the idea of willful
                  blindness.

(originally, in a condition prepared for worship), pure (either
                  ethically, or ritually, ceremonially), chaste.
purely, sincerely, with pure motives, honestly.
market-place, forum, public place of assembly.
a lounger in the market-place, perhaps with the idea of agitator.

unlettered, illiterate, uneducated, perhaps with the narrower idea:
                  unacquainted with Rabbinic teaching.
I spend the night in the open
I spend the night in the open, bivouac.

a field, especially as bearing a crop; the country, lands, property in
                  land, a country estate.
I am not asleep, am awake; especially: I am watchful, careful.
the state of being awake (at night), sleeplessness, watching.

I lead, lead away, bring (a person, or animal), guide, spend a day,
                  go.
a leading, guiding; hence: mode of life, conduct.
an (athletic) contest; hence, a struggle (in the soul).

(properly the feeling of the athlete before a contest), great fear,
                  terror, of death; anxiety, agony.

I am struggling, striving (as in an athletic contest or warfare); I
                  contend, as with an adversary.
Adam, the first man, the first parent of the human race.
without expense, for which nothing has to be paid.

Addi, son of Cosam, and father of Melchi, one of the ancestors of
                  Jesus.
a sister, a woman (fellow-)member of a church, a Christian woman.

a brother, member of the same religious community, especially a
                  fellow-Christian.

brotherhood (in the collective sense), the members of the Christian
                  Church, Christendom.

the quality of being unseen (of disappearing), indefiniteness,
                  uncertainty.

out of sight, obscurely, inconspicuously, uncertainly, without certain
                  aim.
I feel fear, lack courage, am distressed, troubled.
I act unjustly towards, injure, harm.

a legal wrong, crime (with which one is charged), misdeed, crime
                  against God, a sin.
failing to pass the test, unapproved, counterfeit.
belonging to Adramyttium, a port in Mysia, in Asia Minor.

the Hadria, a name given by sailors not merely to the Adriatic Sea, to
                  which it properly belonged, but also to the open Mediterranean to the south-east
                  of Italy, to the sea that lay between Malta, Italy, Greece, and Crete.
to be impossible; I am unable.

of persons: incapable; of things: impossible; either the inability, or
                  that which is impossible.
always, unceasingly, perpetually; on every occasion.

unleavened, the paschal feast (a feast of the Hebrews); fig:
                  uncorrupted, sincere.
Azor, son of Eliakim and father of Zadok, an ancestor of Jesus.

Azotus, Ashdod, a coast town of Palestine belonging to the ancient
                  Philistia, and part of Herod's kingdom.
air, the lower air we breathe.
without god, without (the only true) God, godless.

I annul, make of no effect, set aside, ignore, slight; I break faith
                  with.
Athens, the intellectual capital of Greece.
I engage, compete, in an (athletic) contest.
a struggling (as in an athletic contest).
I lose heart, am despondent, am disheartened.
sea-coast, (sandy) beach; shore (of sea or lake), land.
a shedding or pouring forth of blood
a shedding or pouring forth of blood (in sacrifice).
I suffer from a continual flow (oozing) of blood
I suffer from a continual flow (oozing) of blood.

Aenon; Eusebius and Jerome place this site 8 (Roman) miles south of
                  Scythopolis near the Jordan.

a self-chosen opinion, a religious or philosophical sect, discord or
                  contention.
disposed to form sects, sectarian, heretical, factious.
I raise, lift up, take away, remove.
greedily, in a spirit of eagerness for base gain.
I am ashamed, am put to shame
I am ashamed, am put to shame.

a cause, reason, excuse; a charge, accusation; guilt; circumstances,
                  case.
the cause of, the originator of
the cause, author; the culprit, the accused; the crime.
I take captive (in war); I subdue, ensnare.
an age, a cycle of time

an age, a cycle (of time), especially of the present age as contrasted
                  with the future age, and of one of a series of ages stretching to infinity.

age-long, and therefore: practically eternal, unending; partaking of
                  the character of that which lasts for an age, as contrasted with that which is
                  brief and fleeting.
I am without a suitable opportunity
I am without a suitable opportunity.
unseasonably, out of due season, inopportunely.
a thorn-bush, prickly plant; a thorn.
not open to just rebuke; irreprehensible.
indissoluble, that cannot be broken up
indissoluble, that cannot be broken up.
not ceasing from, not abandoning (giving up).

disturbance, upheaval, revolution, almost anarchy, first in the
                  political, and thence in the moral sphere.

unsettled, unstable (though these are hardly strong enough
                  equivalents), almost anarchic.
I reach maturity, become ripe, am in full vigor.
hearing, faculty of hearing, ear; report, rumor.
I hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported.
incontinence, intemperance (in wide sense), lack of restraint.
lacking self-control, powerless, inclined to excess.

strictness, accuracy, exactness, attention to detail,
                  scrupulousness.
I learn carefully, inquire with exactness.
auditorium, recitation hall, court room (for hearing cases).
a hearer of, a listener to
a hearer of, a listener to.

(a technical word of Jewish use) foreskin, prepuce: used sometimes as a
                  slang term by Jews, of Gentiles.
in the corner (of a building); subst: corner-(stone).

(lit: top of a heap), first-fruits, spoil, treasure (taken in
                  war).

the Greek way of writing the Latin Aquila, a male proper name; the
                  husband of Priscilla (Prisca), and a Jew, of a family belonging to (Sinope in ?)
                  Pontus.
I annul, make of no effect, cancel
I annul, make of no effect, cancel.
(characteristic of legal documents), without hindrance, freely.

unwilling, generally used where English would express by an adverb:
                  unwillingly.
a phial or bottle of perfumed ointment, usually of alabaster.

boasting, show, arrogant display, ostentation; plur: occasions of
                  ostentation.

a boaster, one who gives one's self airs in a loud and flaunting
                  way.
I cry aloud, a clanging or clashing cymbal
I cry aloud, raise a war-cry; a clanging or clashing cymbal.
unable to speak or articulate; speechless.

I anoint: festivally, in homage, medicinally, or in anointing the
                  dead.
the cockcrow, as a period of time, between midnight and 3 a.m.
an Alexandrian, a native (or resident) of Alexandria in Egypt.
Alexandrian, belonging to Alexandria in Egypt.

Alexander, a name of Greek origin, (a) son of Simon of Cyrene, (b) the
                  High Priest's kinsman, (c) an Ephesian Jew, (d) the coppersmith.

truth, but not merely truth as spoken; truth of idea, reality,
                  sincerity, truth in the moral sphere, divine truth revealed to man,
                  straightforwardness.
I say, speak truth, I do truth
I say (speak) truth, do truth, maintain truth (the truth).
unconcealed, true, true in fact, worthy of credit, truthful.
true (lit: made of truth), real, genuine.
I salt, sprinkle with salt, keep fresh and sound

I salt, sprinkle with salt (of sacrifices or of those who offer
                  sacrifice), keep fresh and sound, and so acceptable to God.
pollution, perhaps a polluted thing (especially of food).
from another quarter, by another way
from another place, by another way.
I leap, leap up; of water: I spring up, bubble up.
other, another (of more than two), different.
a prier into other men's affairs

one who meddles in things alien to his calling or in matters belonging
                  to others; factious.

belonging to another person, belonging to others, foreign,
                  strange.
foreign, of another tribe or race.
without reason, irrational; contrary to reason, absurd.
aloes, the powdered fragrant aloe wood.

Alphaeus; apparently two persons, (a) father of Levi, and (b) father of
                  James.
a fox; a fox-like, crafty person.
at the same time, along with
at the same time, therewith, along with, together with.

originally: I miss the mark, hence (a) I make a mistake, (b) I sin,
                  commit a sin (against God); sometimes the idea of sinning against a
                  fellow-creature is present.

prop: missing the mark; hence: (a) guilt, sin, (b) a fault, failure (in
                  an ethical sense), sinful deed.
peaceable, abstaining from fighting, not contentious.

amethyst (a kind of rock crystal: the best specimens are the color of
                  unmixed wine, whence perhaps the name), believed to stave off drunkenness.
I neglect, am careless of, disregard.
blameless, free from fault or defect.

free from anxiety (though anxiety is rather too strong a word) or
                  care.

not to be repented of, about which no change of mind can take place,
                  not affected by change of mind.
not measurable, immeasurable, to a limitless degree.
verily, truly, amen, so let it be

verily, truly, amen; at the end of sentences may be paraphrased by: So
                  let it be.
whose mother's name is not recorded or known

(lit: motherless), whose mother's name is not recorded (or
                  known).

Amminadab, son of Ram and father of Nahshon, one of the ancestors of
                  Jesus.

a lamb (as a type of innocence, and with sacrificial
                  connotation).

a change, an exchange; hence plur: reciprocal good deeds (services), a
                  fitting requital.

Ampliatus (Amplias), a male member of the church at Rome, probably of
                  the imperial household.
I ward off, defend myself against, resist, defend, assist.
prop: something thrown around; a fishing-net, drag-net.
Amphipolis, a leading city of Macedonia.
prop: a road around anything; the street of a village.

Amon (Amos), son of Manasseh and father of Josiah, an ancestor of
                  Jesus.
Amos, son of Manasseh and father of Josiah, an ancestor of Jesus.
an untranslatable word that makes a statement contingent

an untranslatable word (under the circumstances, in that case, anyhow),
                  the general effect of which is to make a statement contingent, which would
                  otherwise be definite: it is thus regularly used with the subjunctive mood.
and, apiece, by, each, every, in, through

prep. Rare in NT; prop: upwards, up; among, between; in turn; apiece,
                  by; as a prefix: up, to, anew, back.
a step, a flight of steps

a step, a flight of steps; the well-known "stairs" leading up from the
                  temple to the tower of Antonia at Jerusalem.
I go up, mount, ascend; of things: I rise, spring up, come up.
I postpone, defer, especially: I postpone the trial of.
I draw up, as a net to shore.
I look up, recover my sight
I look up, recover my sight.
I shout upwards, cry out, raise my voice
I shout upwards, cry out, raise my voice.
I bring back word, report; I announce, declare.
I beget again, beget into a new life
I beget again, beget into a new life.
I read, know again, know certainly, recognize, discern.
by way of compulsion, unwillingly, by force, necessarily.

necessity, constraint, compulsion; there is need to; force,
                  violence.
I make known to again, make to be recognized

I recognize; pass: I am made known, cause myself to be
                  recognized.

recognition, reading; public reading (of the law and prophets in
                  synagogue or church).
I lead up, put to sea, set sail
I lead up, bring up, offer, produce, put to sea, set sail.
I show forth, show clearly, proclaim, appoint

I show forth, show clearly; hence: I proclaim (a person's appointment
                  to an office), appoint.

the proclamation of an appointment (to an office); perhaps rather
                  admission to membership of a society.

I welcome, receive kindly; I undertake, assume the responsibility
                  of.
I send up, deliver, hand over
I send up, deliver, hand over, yield.
I come to life again, revive
I come to life again, revive, regain life.
I seek out, search for (implying the difficulty of the task).

I gird up, brace up (with a view to active exertion); a metaphor from
                  the girding of the flowing tunic, to prevent its hampering one in active
                  work.
I stir up the fire, fan the flame of
I stir up the fire, fan the flame of.
I thrive or flourish again, revive.

a votive offering, a thing devoted to God; a curse, the thing
                  cursed.
I curse, invoke curses, devote to destruction.
I look at attentively, gaze at, consider.
an offering dedicated by a worshipper

an offering dedicated (hung up in a temple) by a worshipper; a gift or
                  offering consecrated to God.
taking away (of life), killing, slaying, murder.
I take up, take away the life of, make an end of, murder.
I make fresh again, renew, restore.
renewing; a renewal or change of heart and life.
I bend or turn back; I return.
I recline, especially at a dinner-table
I recline, especially at a dinner-table.
I sum up, summarize, recapitulate, gather up in one
I sum up, summarize, recapitulate, gather up in one.
I make to recline, I recline at a table

I lay upon, lean against, lay down, make to recline; pass: I lie back,
                  recline.
I examine, inquire into, investigate, question.
I raise myself, look up, am elated.

I take up, raise; I pick up, take on board; I carry off, lead
                  away.

a loosing, departing, departure (from this life); (Probably a metaphor
                  from the yoking and unyoking of transport animals).
I unloose, unloose for departure, depart, return.
I await (one whose coming is expected).

I remind, admonish, am reminded, remind myself; pass: I remember,
                  recall.
I renew; mid: I renew myself, am renewed.
I become sober again, recover sound sense
I become sober again, recover sound sense.

Ananias, (a) husband of Sapphira, a member of the early church at
                  Jerusalem, (b) a member of the church at Damascus, (c) the high priest at
                  Jerusalem.
indisputable, undeniable, not to be contradicted.
I make to rest, give rest to, rest, take my ease

I make to rest, give rest to; mid. and pass: I rest, take my
                  ease.
I urge by evil persuasion, I tempt
I send up to a higher tribunal, I send back
I send up (to a higher tribunal), send back.
I lie down, recline, fall back upon

I lie down, recline (at a dinner-table), fall back upon (the breast of
                  another person reclining at dinner).
I fill up, make up, fulfill

I fill up, make up, complete the measure of, fulfill, carry out the
                  commands (provisions, etc.) of.
I kindle, set on fire, light.
uncountable, innumerable, that cannot be numbered.
I shake up, stir up, excite
I shake up, stir up, excite.
I pervert, subvert, dismantle, unsettle, overthrow, destroy.
I drag up, pull up, draw up, draw out.
I turn upside down, upset, unsettle

(perhaps a political metaphor), I turn upside down, upset,
                  unsettle.

I overturn, turn upside down, return, mid. and pass: I conduct myself,
                  live

I overturn; I turn back, return; I turn hither and thither; pass: I
                  turn myself about; I sojourn, dwell; I conduct myself, behave, live.
dealing with other men, conduct, life, behavior, manner of life.

I arrange, draw up, compose, but perhaps: I set down from memory,
                  restore from memory.
I make to rise, I rise, shine

I make to rise, I rise, shine (generally of the sun, and hence
                  met.).
I lay a case before, impart, communicate, relate

I lay (a case) before, impart, communicate, declare, relate (with a
                  view to consulting).
rising of the sun, the East

(a) rising of the sun, hence (b) (sing. and plur.) the quarter whence
                  the sun rises, the East.
I overturn (lit. or met.), subvert, overthrow, corrupt.
I rear, bring up, nourish, educate.

(a) a nautical term: I sight (a place), (b) mid: I appear (as it were,
                  out of the unseen), (c) I bring to light, make to appear.
I carry up, lead up, offer up

(a) I carry up, lead up, (b) I offer up (on a high altar) as a
                  sacrifice, offer up to God on high.
outpouring, excess, overflow, a pouring out.

I return, retire, withdraw, depart (underlying idea perhaps of taking
                  refuge from danger or of going into retirement).
an enslaver, one who forcibly enslaves, a kidnapper.

Andrew, brother of Simon Peter, and one of the apostles of Jesus,
                  belonging to Bethsaida.
I act like a man, am brave
I act like a man, am brave.

Andronicus, a member of the Roman church, and a kinsman or
                  fellow-tribesman of Paul.
indescribable, that cannot be thoroughly related
indescribable, that cannot be thoroughly related, inexpressible.
I am blown with the wind

I am blown with the wind (referring to the gentler motions of the
                  air).
the wind; fig: applied to empty doctrines.
that cannot be searched into, inscrutable
that cannot be searched into, inscrutable, unfathomable.
enduring evil, patient of evil, patiently forbearing.
having no cause to be ashamed
having no cause to be ashamed.
I come up, go up, ascend.

I examine (a person on trial, a witness) judicially (frequently by the
                  aid of torture).
without, without the cooperation or knowledge of
without, without the cooperation (or knowledge) of.
unfitted, unsuitable, inconvenient, not well placed.
I find by seeking out, discover.
I endure, bear with, have patience with, suffer, admit, persist.
a male human being, a man
a male human being; a man, husband.
I take a stand against, oppose, resist
I set against; I withstand, resist, oppose.

I make a mutual agreement; I confess, acknowledge, formally admit, give
                  thanks to.

bloom, possibly a reference to the bright flowers, such as poppies
                  (among the grass).
a coal-fire, a heap of burning coals.

desirous of pleasing men, a renderer of service to human beings (as
                  opposed to God).

belonging to human beings (especially as contrasted with God), human
                  (as contrasted with divine).
a man, one of the human race
a man, one of the human race.
to act as proconsul, be a deputy
to act as proconsul, be a deputy.
I let go, loosen, release, give up, neglect

I send up, produce, send back; I let go; I relax, loosen, hence met: I
                  give up, desist from.
I raise up, set up, rise from

I raise up, set up; I rise from among (the) dead; I arise,
                  appear.
Anna, a prophetess, who visited the infant Jesus.

I rebuild, build up (what has fallen or been razed to the ground),
                  sometimes merely: I build.
I make straight again, rear again, restore
I make upright (straight) again, rear again, restore.
forbearance, suspense or delay (of punishment), patience.
I fill up in place of someone else
I fill up in place of someone else, complete, supply.
a gift in return, a return, a recompense
a gift in return (for another), a return, recompense, requital.
I contradict, reply against, give a hostile answer.
I speak or say in opposition, I contradict
I speak or say in opposition, contradict (oppose, resist).

trans: I hold against; intrans: I withstand; mid: I hold out against,
                  hold firmly to, cleave to.

(a) instead of, in return for, over against, opposite, in exchange for,
                  as a substitute for, (b) on my behalf, (c) wherefore, because.
I throw at in opposition, exchange words with

I throw at in opposition, exchange (words) with, perhaps: I
                  compare.

a proposition, tenet, opinion advanced by one party against another;
                  opposition.
I resist, oppose, withstand, lie opposite to.
right opposite, off (nautical sense), over against.
I take hold of, help, share in
I take hold of, help, share in, partake of, enjoy.
I speak or say in opposition, contradict
I speak or say in opposition, contradict (oppose, resist).
I abuse in return, give abuse for abuse
I abuse in return, give abuse for abuse.
I measure in return, give equivalent measure
I measure in return, give equivalent measure.

Antioch, (a) Antioch on the river Orontes, capital of the Province
                  Syria, (b) "Pisidian" Antioch, not in Pisidia, but near Pisidia, in the Roman
                  Province Galatia.
an Antiochian, an inhabitant of Antioch.
I pass opposite, on the opposite side of the road.
Antipas, a Christian martyr of Pergamum.

Antipatris, a town, where was a Roman colony, on the road between
                  Caesarea and Jerusalem.
on the opposite side or shore
on the opposite side or shore.
I fall foul of, resist, oppose
I resist, oppose, fall against or upon.
I set myself against, resist (the attack of).
typical of, representing by type or pattern

typical of, representing by type (or pattern), corresponding to, an
                  image.

antichrist, either one who puts himself in the place of, or the enemy
                  (opponent) of the Messiah.

I draw (generally water from a deep well in the ground); perhaps: I
                  draw out.
what is drawn; a vessel or bucket to draw with.

I face (lit: "I present my eye to"), resist, withstand; as nautical
                  term: I bear up against the wind.
without water, dry; subst: dry places, desert.

up, above, up to the top, up to the brim, things above, heaven, the
                  heavenly region.
from above, from the beginning, again

(a) from above, from heaven, (b) from the beginning, from their origin
                  (source), from of old, (c) again, anew.
higher, to a more honorable place, previously, above

higher, to a more honorable place (at the dinner table); previously, in
                  an earlier passage (or a book), above.
worthy, worthy of, deserving, comparable, suitable.
I account or treat as worthy
I account or treat as worthy.
worthily, in a manner worthy of
worthily, in a manner worthy of.
I report, bring a report, announce

I report (from one place to another), bring a report, announce,
                  declare.
I choke, strangle; mid: I strangle or hang myself.
I lead, carry, take away; met: I am led astray, seduced.

untrained, uneducated, showing a want of training or education,
                  ignorant.
I take away, remove; pass: I am taken away, withdrawn.
I ask back, ask what is my due
I ask back, ask what is my due, demand back.
I am past feeling, cease to care, become callous

(lit: I cease to feel [my] pain), am past feeling, cease to care
                  (suggesting sometimes despair, sometimes recklessness), become callous,
                  reckless.

I free (a person) from (anything), oftener in the middle voice: I am
                  released from, am rid of (a person or thing), depart.
I estrange, alienate; pass: I am alienated from.
soft, tender, as a shoot of a tree.
I go to meet, meet, encounter.
the act of meeting, to meet

the act of meeting, to meet (a phrase seemingly almost technical for
                  the reception of a newly arrived official).

I deny, disown, repudiate (either another person or myself),
                  disregard.

the first-fruits, the earliest crop of the year, hence also met., for
                  example, of the earliest converts in a district; there is evidence in favor of
                  rendering in some passages merely by: sacrifice, gift.
I deceive, cheat, lead into error.
a light flashing forth, radiation, gleam
a light flashing forth (from), radiation, gleam.
I disobey, rebel, am disloyal, refuse conformity.
unbelieving, disobedient, who will not be persuaded.
untried, inexperienced, incapable of being tempted
untried, inexperienced, untempted, incapable of being tempted.
I expect eagerly, wait for eagerly
I expect eagerly, wait for eagerly, look for.
a putting off (as of a garment), a casting off.

a freedman, one who has been a slave but has been manumitted by his
                  master.

I give up in despair, despair of; I hope to receive from or in
                  return.
over against, opposite, in view of, in the presence of
against, over against, opposite, in view of, in the presence of.
I come or go away from, depart, return
I come or go away from, depart, return, arrive, go after, follow.
I abstain from, keep myself away from.
I have in full, am far, it is enough
I have in full, am far, it is enough.
I am unfaithful, disbelieve, refuse belief, prove false.

unbelieving, incredulous, unchristian; sometimes subst:
                  unbeliever.
I go or come out of, disembark, result
I go or come out of, disembark, turn out, result, become, happen.
I throw away from, throw overboard
I throw away from, throw overboard, cast aside.
I look away from, turn my attention to
I look away from all else at one object, look steadfastly.
worthy to be cast away, worthless
worthy to be cast away, worthless, regarded as vile.
a casting away, rejection, a loss.
I go out of being, cease to be, die
I am away, am removed from, depart life, die.
I enroll, inscribe in a register

I enroll, inscribe in a register; mid: I give my name for registration
                  (or census-taking).
I show by proof, demonstrate, set forth
I show by proof, demonstrate, set forth, proclaim to an officer.
I take off a tenth part, pay tithe

I take off (deduct) a tenth part (of my property) (and give it away),
                  pay tithe.
worthy to be received, acceptable, welcome
